snippet: The United States and leaders of other major industrialized nations averted a clash with President Vladimir Putin of Russia by avoiding mention of the most contentious matters that divided them.
abstract: United States and leaders of other major industrialized nations avert clash with Pres Vladimir Putin of Russia during Group of 8 meeting by avoiding mention of the most contentious matters dividing them, including fate of Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria; group manages to find some unity on economic issues despite differences between Pres Obama and Europeans over austerity measures.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: The United States and leaders of other major industrialized nations averted a clash with President Vladimir Putin of Russia by avoiding mention of the most contentious matters that divided them.

headline.main: G-8 Meeting Ends With Cordial Stalemate on Syria
headline.print_headline: G-8 Leaders Sidestep Differences Over Syria, but Advance Economic Goals
